clinical_study.brief_title: QUARTO-II Study to Evaluate the Management of Patients Resynchronized With the QuartetTM LV Quadripolar Lead
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study to Evaluate the Management of Patients Resynchronized With the QuartetTM LV Quadripolar Lead

brief_summary.textblock: Optimization and evolution of the patient will be evaluated over 6 months after the implant.

detailed_description.textblock: Patient will be enrolled into the study after Informed Consent signature and CRT-D+quadripolar (QuartetTM) LV lead.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From implant procedure until 6 months post-implant
primary_outcome.description: Optimization method. The primary endpoint of this study is to evaluate the usual management (according to the different methods of optimisation used) of patients undergoing Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy (CRT), that have a QuartetTM quadripolar lead with a CRT-D Device implanted during the 6 months post-implant. Information about the optimization method used, parameters and variables used with them and number of optimization during 6months post-implant will be collected.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From implant procedure until 6 months post-implant
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with device-related adverse events as a measure of safety, deaths, cardiovascular hospitalizations and hospitalisations for any reason, assessed up to 6 months post-implant.
Structural remodelling is defined as a reduction >15% in End Systolic Volume of the Left Ventricle (LVESV), measured 6months after implant.
Collect demographic information (gender, age, height, weight), medical and cardiovascular history.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treated Ventricular Tachycardia (VT) / Ventricular Fibrillation (VF) episodes incidence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From implant procedure until 6 months post-implant
secondary_outcome.description: Number of treated TV/FV episodes over the 6 months post-implant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with implanted CRT-D device and a QuartetTM quadripolar lead by St. Jude Medical in the left ventricle.
- Patient with an echocardiographic study performed during 1 month prior to the implant and in whom End Systolic Volume of the Left Ventricle (LVESV) has been measured
- Patients who have granted their informed consent.
- Patients above 18 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients that have been previously resynchronized.
- Patients with aortic stenosis or aortic valve prosthesis
- Patients who are or may potentially be pregnant.
- Patients with a life expectancy <12 months.
- Patients who cannot attend the monitoring visits established by the protocol.
